g:HTMLPanel.p: In this chapter we built two playlist widgets and developed three service classes, each of which get data from YouTube in various ways.
JSONP Video Service - This will display the VideoPlaylist widget using the JsonPVideoService.
JS Overlay Video Service - This will display the VideoPlaylist widget using the JsOverlayVideoService.
XML Video Service* - This will display the VideoPlaylist widget using the XmlVideoService. This requires the server to run the XmlVideoProxyServlet in order to work properly.
XML/Form Video Service* - This will display the VideoPlaylistForm widget, which makes use of the XmlVideoService. This requires the server to run the XmlVideoProxyServlet in order to work properly.

* The examples that use the XmlVideoService make use of a proxy in order to fetch the data from a remote server (e.g. YouTube). The servlet must be installed on the same server that is used to host the examples. The additional jar files required to run this servlet are commons-httpclient, commons-codec, and commons-logging, all of which are included with the example code or may be downloaded from the Jakarta Commons website (http://commons.apache.org/).
